availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married Louise Morgan Parsons in Harlan County, Kentucky, on March 20, 1830. Father of Pheoba Parsons, Samuel Parsons, Elizabeth Parsons, Joseph Parsons, Elisha Parsons, Deana Parsons, Rebecca Parsons, and Louisa J. Parsons. Farmer in Lee County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Clay County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Lee County, District 31, p. 413B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 120.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, Pond Creek Precinct, p. 218A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harlan County Marriages, Film 000834238.
